cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.CE. 

The paper focuses on influence measures for data classification, which is a topic that falls under the machine learning and artificial intelligence fields. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the properties that any reasonable influence measure should satisfy, which is related to the field of data science, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also mentions the importance of privacy and not having access to the underlying classifier, which is related to the field of cryptography, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the effectiveness of the proposed influence measures on real datasets, which is related to the field of computational engineering, making cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) a possible sub-category.
